clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Amblyomin-X in Advanced Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Study (First in Humans) of the Amblyomin-X in the Treatment of Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors Refractory or Without Indication / Access to Standard Treatment

collaborator.agency: Buranello e Rodrigues Consultoria em Desenvolvimento Farmacêutico Ltda ME

brief_summary.textblock: Amblyomin-X is an inhibitor of Factor Xa that also acts as an apoptotic agent for tumor cells. In the case of in vitro assays, Amblyomin-X induces tumor cells to death and does not affect the viability of normal cells. When in vivo assays were performed on mice bearing tumors, treatment with Amblyomin-X caused a significant reduction in tumor mass and number of metastases.

detailed_description.textblock: This trial will be the first clinical study in humans with the product, which until then has been studied only in experimental models. Given the current epidemiological impact of cancer and the need to improve its systemic treatment, making it available to a larger portion of the Brazilian population, it is proposed to conduct the first Amblyomin-X study in cancer patients, more specifically those with advanced solid tumors For which there is no contraindicated or inaccessible therapeutic option established as the standard at the time of inclusion in the study.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Delay in the R & D stage

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Study with dose escalation regime, done according to the classic scheme known as "3 + 3"

primary_outcome.measure: grade 4 or non-haematological grade 3 haematological toxicity according to the CTCAE (version 4)
primary_outcome.description: Presence of grade 4 or non-haematological grade 3 haematological toxicity according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE, version 4)

secondary_outcome.measure: maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and the recommended dose for phase II
secondary_outcome.description: This will be based on dose-limiting toxicity of the previous cohort

arm_group.description: This cohort will include 3 patients with the first calculated dose of Amblyomin-X drug. The patient will receive the intravenous drug. If no Dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) in this group the study continues including the next cohort. However, if If only one patient in a given cohort develops DLT, three more patients will be included at that dose level, up to a maximum total of six patients per dose level. If two or more of the three patients of a certain dose level develop DLT, this dose level is considered very toxic, and the study does not proceed. If this occurs at the first dose level, the study will be finalized. If only one in six patients at a dose level develops DLTs, escalation proceeds until Tolerated Maximum Dose.
